titles.title: A bill to make applicable the provisions of the Act commonly known as the "Warren Act" to the Central Utah Project, Utah, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7150)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Water and Power.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Water and Power. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 103-844.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment. With written report No. 103-380.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 634.

bill.summary: 9/26/1994--Reported to Senate amended. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior, using any facilities associated with the Central Utah Project, Utah, to enter into: (1) contracts with private entities pursuant to the Warren Act for the impoundment, storage, and carriage of nonproject water for domestic, municipal, fish and wildlife, industrial, and other beneficial purposes; and (2) agreements under such Act with appropriate officials of other Federal agencies, municipalities, water districts and agencies, and States for the use of nonproject water for such purposes. Permits any employee, or member of the Board of Directors, of the Central Utah Water Conservancy District to serve as a member of the Utah Reclamation Mitigation and Conservation Commission.
